abstracts.cdata!:
The Financial Sector Adjustment Credit
            Project (FSAC) for Nicaragua will provide a loan of
            $70,000,000 to the Government of Nicaragua for its
            structural adjustment program. The objectives of the program
            aim to: 1) carry out a major reform of the state banking
            sector; 2) improve financial intermediation, especially in
            rural areas; and 3) improve the regulatory framework for
            private banking. In order to achieve these objectives, the
            FSAC project will support measures to: 1) maintain a stable
            macroeconomic framework; 2) restructure the state banking
            system, including the closure of one state bank and the
            capitalization by private investors of another state bank;
            3) foster private banking presence in the rural and
            agricultural sectors; and 4) strengthen the regulatory
            framework for, and supervision of, private banking. These
            measures will allow the Government of Nicaragua to address
            major obstacles to sustainable private sector led growth and
            mobilize additional balance of payments support.
